The staff are mainly very attentive and responsive. The room is fairly standard. Comfortable. Nothing to complain about. Breakfast choices at the Cafe Serena is not that wide but lunch buffet is good. Overall, a decent place to stay. Nothing much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice !! Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: rainman1956
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 night at Nikko Hotel this month 9/14-16 . I needed to stop in HK on my way to vietnam fir a couple days . I usually try to stay in TST area . I had not stayed at Nikko before , all I knew was it was next to Grand Stafford ( Nice) so I knew it was it nice location. It was rated 4 -5* depending on which web site you looked at . Found a nice rate of $148 USD on bookings.com . I checked in late at night on 9/14 , staff was friendly and helpfull . I was upgraded to the club floor (14 & 15 ) . I was also told that my rate included breakfest each morning . I was given king room on 15th floor , and to my suprise it had a nice harbor view , Also on 15th floor was the health club and pool . They also have very nice lounge with outsatnding view of harbor . As i mentioned room was pretty big with King bed ( very firm ) Nice desk , closet and safe . bathroom was pretty big and had seperate tub and shower. Hotel lobby was really nice , buffett breakfest was nice and there was plenty of selections for western travelors . Overall it was really good stay , I was worried because after booking reservations , I had read some unpleasant reviews on this Hotel . I would definitely stay at this hotel again . Great location , great price and nice rooms

Reviews.Title: “value 4 star hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: welltraveledA
Reviews.Content: good hotel in kowloon i think is the less expensive harbour view room you can get in TST ,kowloon (may be in hung hom) corner room,small ,lcd tv just remade at the time not every room was remodelated breakfast is expensive and normal,better go to deli france just one block away in hkc visit FELIX at the peninsula (dont miss harbour view men bathroom)

Reviews.Title: “Nice for Orientals”
Reviews.Author: negra30
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, but the breackfast is made for Asian people, the only thing that I coul eat was eggs, there wasn´t cheese, and more occidental things, only red beans roll, congee, etc

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive for such an average hotel”
Reviews.Author: xksb
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Nikko hotel for two nights while on business. Their function rooms are bad, overlooking the habour and food served was alright. We had lunch at their restaurant - buffet style - and the place as packed. Food was good, but not spectacular. The rooms are average. In my opinion, quite spacious for HK standards - especially the bathroom. Most hotels in HK would not carry both a bath and a shower, this one had both. However, their mirrors were not well placed (the small mirrors that turn out) and not enough closet space. Their TV is so small, I had to sit closer to the TV on the bed - could do with about 5" bigger - TV isn't in proportion to the rest of the furniture in the room. Internet is not free. Their rooms are overpriced considering their location and decor (which needs an upgrade). I was disappointed to find that the busboy expected a tip. There are better hotels in the surrounding area - Kowloon Shangri-la etc. Hotel Nikko is a rip off mainly catered to Japanese tourists.

Reviews.Title: “ripoff”
Reviews.Author: travelmaniak
Reviews.Content: An average hotel regarding International standards. Prices too high. I found out that Caucasians and Japanese are paying a hefty upcharge! I have checked out immediately after one night and moved to the Royal Pacific Hotel. Here I got value for my money!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Extra Charges”
Reviews.Author: globalreach
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and service good. Rooms are small, espcially by 4 star standards. Stayed on the Nikko Floor and was suppose to get free local calls; dialed 800 number and got charged $HK30 or about $4.00 per call. They told me 800 numbers don't count as local calls. Also charged $HK330 or about $45 US for two glasses of wine for my wife at the lounge. (she was in town on a different trip). Exchange rate for money at desk is about 6% lower than what you'll get on the street so go to Nathan Rd to exchange your money. Broadband access at Nikko Lounge only means the signal; they charge to use their computers. OK hotel, definitely not 4 star. Stay next door at the Intercontinental for a much nice experience and same great location.

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: My-View-on-things
Reviews.Content: On two occasions I was asked if I was interested in a massage* while walking to my room after a night in town. This is unacceptable, and I didn't feel I was taken seriously when mentioning this when checking out. For the rest the hotel itself isn't too bad. Unfortunately the pool was closed due to maintenance. Breakfast wasn't up to (their own price) standard. According to one of my colleagues his room-phone bill was the worst he had ever seen. Overall just okay, but there certainly are better hotels around.. one night we had a perfect dinner at the Peninsula hotel's Felix Bar, and decided next time we'd surely stay at the Peninsula! * the kind you get arrested for

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Sivan L
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Nikko hotel during the Chinese new year of 2007. The hotel location is great, it is very close to the Avenue of Stars. we had an harbor view room which costs a bit more than a regular room, but the view at night is worth it, just be sure to ask for a room with a full view to the harbor, some rooms have partial view. The service was great, the only issue is that not all of the hotel staff masters English, but you always find a way to explain yourself eventually. The rooms in the hotel are clean, the bathroom is huge and has both a shower and a bathtub. The hotel is a bit pricy but it worth the price, I will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with hotel”
Reviews.Author: ERguy
Reviews.Content: My 13 year old daughter and I stayed at the Nikko Hotel in Hong Kong for 5 nights. During that time, on 3 different occasions, she and/or I were walked in on by housekeeping. First a "man in a suit" walked in on my daughter while she was alone in the room. Next, a housekeeper walked in on both of us without waiting even 15 seconds after knocking. Third time was with me in the bathroom doorway just after a shower. A housekeeper walked in on me and obviously got a vision that will haunt her for the rest of her life! I complained to the hotel manager(s) who said they would take care of it, but they obviously didnt. My daughter also went to "check out" the hotel pool, and ended up being followed by a male staff member the whole time who was well inside her personal space. It made her so uncomfortable that she refused to go back to the pool, even with me. The concierge and desk staff weren't very helpful either. I asked for recommendation(s) for somewhere to eat, and they told me, "nothing is very good around here", and left it at that. English is not very good with many of the staff as well. We also were a definite minority at the hotel. It was jammed with hundreds of Japanese tourists milling around the lobby and the facilities. It was hard to get any help or use the facility amenities. The restaurants were very expensive. The phone calls are not free. The business center was always busy, but cost $40 per 15 minutes use. All in all, not a very happy experience. I could not recommend this hotel to anyone. I will not return. They call themselves a 5-star hotel. I'd say 3-stars at best. With all the choices in Hong Kong, anyone would be better staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “What you book is Not what you Get!!”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterMa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Nikko last week, following a week at the Conrad HK. Booked a harbor view Nikko floor room for 2 adults and 1 child. Room was confirmed with rate and when we checked in were forced to sign document changing the rate by an extra 600 hkd for our daughter. They claimed that they gave us a larger room (not true) to accommodate cot. We showed them our confirmation from them and they would not budge. We signed as the Dragon Boat races were that weekend and we could not find another hotel to stay at as they were all sold out for the weekend. During our stay we found the beds to be terribly hard, the rooms dated and the breakfast mediocre at best. The rooftop pool was closed several times due to threat of thunderstorm, even though the sky was blue and sun was shining. We often wondered, with other guests, which weather channel they were watching. When pool open, there is no shade and only 2 umbrellas, 1 which the 2 lifeguards sit under. The staff at the Nikko is quite inflexible/indifferent and should truly remember who exactly is paying the bill. We will go back to the Conrad next time.

Reviews.Title: “Only worth 3 stars!”
Reviews.Author: ldlowe04
Reviews.Content: This hotel is asking for 5 star prices and should only be rated 3 stars. Overall, the hotel needs renovations. The rooms are quite dated and the carpets definitely need to be changed. We stayed on the 3rd floor facing the street, so it got a little noisy from time to time. By HK standards, this place is just OK. Don't bother getting the breakfast buffet rate unless you want to eat the same thing every day. You're in HK, which means there's so much to eat here! By the 3rd day, we were tired of the same selection, but still felt obligated to eat there because we had paid extra for it (I believe it was $175 HKD per person). Quite a walking distance to MTR, but close to the train that takes you to Shenzhen (which is a must for shopaholics!) When you are there, make sure you try dim sum at the "Laurel" restaurant upstairs at the mall and get a massage at one of the many luxury spas (you can go to the bottom floor of the mall and catch a shuttle, but make sure you have a mandarin speaking person with you!) For what I paid, I probably won't stay here again. If you like this area (which is the quieter part of TST), I would try the Intercontinental next store.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience.”
Reviews.Author: lindso
Reviews.Content: The service was exemplary. The staff were polite and very helpful. The rooms were spacious and very clean. The restaurants were excellent, particularly Les Celebrites (although one had to eat a little earlier than we preferred, since it closed at 9:30) and Toh Lee. The location was ideal for access to Nathan Road and the Star Ferry (about 15 minutes walk) and there were many good shops and restaurants in the immediate vicinity. We preferred this location to the Marc Polo Hong Kong, where we had stayed in earlier, as it was a much more pleasant area for walking around and was a little less frantic than Harbour City. We would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay but the staff at the hotel can be clueless”
Reviews.Author: dcnetworks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Nikko a total of 3 nights in Feb 2007. I booked the hotel using Expedia (the reservation confirmed by Expedia but the payments were made at the hotel. Due to an overbooking made by my airline, I arrived at HK exactly 1 day late. In foresight, I called the Hotel Nikko from the airport and told them of my flight problem. I was told by a Hotel Nikko reservation specialist to make sure I get something in writing from my airline to indicate the fact that my flight was overbooked. I arrived at the Hotel Nikko a day after my check-in date. Check-in was a snap (granted it was midnight). The check-in staff made a copy of my boarding pass and airline letter. I asked the front desk clerk if I am going to be charged for the night I missed. He told me the reservation manager will review the documents and then contact me later on the day. I agreed. Hotel location: Hotel Nikko is located at the far east end of Mody Road. It is a bit secluded/quiet but it is within walking distance to Nathan Road, the MTR, Starbucks, Inexpensive rest. and the Kowloon harbor. I booked the lowest rate possible (an excellent deal on-line) and still got a huge room on the 10th floor. See downloaded photo. The tv in the room was a bit small but the room was very comfortable (no loud air-conditioner or strange smell). The room has a small fridge, 2 free bottles of water given daily and a fruit basket - refilled by the maid daily. I loved the bathroom (it has a walk-in shower and a deep soaking tub). All the hotel service staff I encountered were very nice. At check-in, I did not upgrade my room nor was I asked by the check-in staff if I wanted an upgrade. I did use the business center on the 14th floor once ($40 HKD for 15 minutes). After a full day of running around the city, I returned in the afternoon and received a message from the reservation manager. I went to the front desk and inquired about my request on file. The front desk staff member checked and then said my request was denied. I told him that was unacceptable because I called the hotel ahead of time. In any rate, he connected me by phone with the reservation manager. The reservation manager repeated to me 3-times that it was due to personal circumstances that I arrived late to the hotel therefore I would be charged for the night I missed. I persisted with her over the phone for like 5 minutes before she agreed to view the travel voucher I received from the airline. To make the long story short, I never received a formal response from the reservation manager but when I checked out the next day, I was not charged for the night I missed at the hotel. The check-out staff told me that I might still be charged for the night I missed and my request was still pending. O well. Overall, I enjoyed my relaxing stay at the Hotel Nikko. I would stay there again but I would make sure I have everything clearly documented. I won't expect too much from the reservation/front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “too modern by half!”
Reviews.Author: rosstucker
Reviews.Content: Just like Hong Kong itself, this hotel is a bit of " the modern" mixed in with some frustrating details. Basically, it is a business and group tour hotel which manages successfully to retain a sort of personalized touch. (We stayed there twice in December -- and in January -- for a total of five nights.) The personal touch was exemplified by the dining room on Christmas day: when we expressed some doubt about eating lobster, crab, and so on; they rushed around and got us turkey, cranberries, dressing, etc. This was while the dining room was overwhelmed with customers! Unbelievable service! What more could one ask? On the other hand, the hotel seems to want to offer individual guests all kinds of deals -- and one is escorted to the fourteenth floor to hear about "special offers" when all one wants is to go to one's room. The room seems to be overwhelmed with technology -- requiring virtually an engineering degree to figure out things like light switches, draperies, and so on. The harbour view is of container docks to a great extent, but at night the distant skyline is certainly worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “a good stay”
Reviews.Author: trixiebear
Reviews.Content: Rather than staying on Hong Kong island as I normally would booked into for this trip in Nov 2006 as I was attending a conference in the hotel, and then extended over the weekend. The hotel was a pleasant surprise located in one of the less crowded parts of Hong Kong we've been to - reminded more of home in S'pore. Rooms were excellent, a very good size by HK standards and well apointed as well. Service was excellent and it was a generally very enjoyable four night stay. There are also some good bars and restaurants very nearby fronting onto the road looking over to HK island itself. The location can seem a bit inconvenient for central but if you take the MTR rather than a taxi its far quicker. Overall a pleasant surprise, if slightly beyond my normal budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, excellent service, nicely refurbished”
Reviews.Author: tomtom333
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Nikko many times over the years, but lately been tempted away by other hotels such as the Shangri La. I had occasion to visit Hong Kong during a trade fair which meant my 1st choice hotels were all full. I went back to the Nikko and was pleasantly surprised. I stayed in a Nikko Floor room with Harbour view. The room was newly refurished and was very comfortable. The bathroom too had been overhauled. The Nikko floor lounge provides excellent service and amenities. The breakfast selection was good as was the selection at cocktail hour. The food in the restaurants was great. I would recommend this Hotel as a cheaper alternative to the well known 5 star hotels on Kowloon and as a much better alternative to the tourist hotels on offer. The location in Mody Road means you are not far from the buzz of Kowloon and very near the best walk along the habour front overlooking the lights of Hong Kong Island.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Nikko, Hong Kong”
Reviews.Author: Dublin_Dude
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nikko for 7 nights, rm 1441. Upgraded on arrival to the Nikko Floor. We bought the extra upgrade that allowed us to use the Nikko Lounge which has spectacular views of the Harbour and Hong Kong Island. Free champagne, Sushi, dim sum etc from 6pm onwards and free snacks all day. The bedroom was very spacious, ample space, and extremely large bathroom. The beds were very comfortable, absolutely no complaints. Location is great for all attractions with only a short ride on the underground and the area is great for walking, providing its not to humid. The breakfast was amazing, with a varied menu to include Western, Japanese and Chinese items. We did spend at least an hour over breakfast every morning, definitely a good start to the day. There is ample choice of restaurants and bars in the area. Definitely will stay here again, if I can afford it.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding levels of Service”
Reviews.Author: matt_hosk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Nikko in October 2006 on the first stage of a seven week round the world trip. At check in we bought an upgrade to the Nikko club, including full breakfasts and use of the Nikko lounge. This was located on the 14th floor with great harbour views, and outstandingly helpful staf who made all our restaurant reservations, reconfirmed our flights etc.. Complementary snacks , ice creams , pots of tea and coffee were inclued at all times; and premium drinks, including champagne, from 6.00 to 9.00pm. Oud bedroom was large ,and the bathroom enormous, with a huge bath and walk in shower. Complementary fruit and distilled water were provided daily. The air conditioning was simple to control and almost silent. Location is 20 minutes walk to Star ferry, but there is an alternative pier fewer than 5 minutes away with a daytime fast ferry service to Central on Hong Kong island. 3 tips: The Nikko is one of the hotels served by the airport express service. Your return ticket includes fast train to Kowloon station, and minibus transfer to the Nikko. Totally painless. After checking out , the minibus takes you back to the station where you can chek in for your flight, say good bye to your hold luggage, and make the most of your last day. Don't forget to visit Lamma island for a fantastic fish and seafood meal at the Rainbow restaurant. They will take you both ways in their private ferry at no extra cost. The hotel will book it all for you. Buy an Octopus card, which is valid on the very efficient public transport. You pre load the card with money, and scan it on buses, trams, ferries etc. when the correct fare is deducted.

Reviews.Title: “needs update but still okay”
Reviews.Author: Carlos_Barcelona
Reviews.Content: Stayed a the Nikko hotel for 3 nights again after 7 years. Hotel is still okay but in my opinion, too tailored for the Japanese tourists. I think it needs a little bit of update. One thing I disliked was that the rooms have no possibility to open windows to air the room, something I can't understand. Rooms a lttle smallish but typical of HG where square meters are not cheap. The Nikko Executive Plant at the top has excellent views of the HK harbour. Service of the employees is all right but could be better for a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sarah3000
Reviews.Content: On arrival, staff did ask us if we wanted to upgrade at extra cost. This would have included an upgraded room, buffet breakfast and use of special lounge. We declined and were not in the slightest bit disappointed with our standard room, it was very clean and comfortable. Facilities were great. Nice pool and gym area. Bistros and restaurants were excellent too. Plenty of eateries within minutes walk and all good value. As mentioned before, location was not central but we walked to the Star Ferry area on one occasion and it only took a 20 minute stroll along a lovely harbourside walkway. There is a free shuttle bus that runs to shopping areas and underground/subway stops, taxis are very good value too. A must do is Lantau Island day trip, booked via hotel reception. Excellent value, very well organised, so much packed in but it didn't seem tiring at all !

Reviews.Title: “Great all inclusive deal”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 6 nights this November. I had a room on the 15th floor with a partial view of the Harbour and my rate was a “business package” that included the business lounge where you are served free soft drinks and cocktails and hors d’oeuvres at various times of the day. Also included were buffet breakfast in the 1st floor dining room (or a much lighter continental breakfast in the afore mentioned lounge), free wireless internet access in both the room and lounge, free access to the health club and to the pool on the roof (which is spectacular) and discounts on laundry, room service and purchases within the hotel. At $HK1550 a night, this package was a great deal and worth every penny. The service was without fault very efficient and instant and the quality of the food at breakfast superior and quite varied. I in fact tried several of the other restaurants within the hotel and all were outstanding (especially Toh Lee for Cantonese cuisine). The room and bathroom amenities were excellent with bathrobes and slippers, a plasma TV screen, cable TV with many channels, a mini bar fridge that could accommodate extra stuff if you wanted, complimentary water, tea and coffee ingredients, an electric kettle, a safe, electronic window drapes, a large bathroom with separate shower stall and bathtub. There wasn’t anything that I could thinks of that I missed. Room service was excellent and very quick. The only minor criticism I have would be that the concierge service was not reliable. I asked for a good restaurant and was told to go to the Jumbo Restaurant off the shore in Aberdeen. The place is inexplicably a tourist must-see where one pays thrice the money for a meal of comparable quality anywhere else. On another occasion I asked how much approximately a taxi would cost to a certain place and was completely misinformed. Other than that, I would not hesitate to recommend the Nikko, provided you go on the all-inclusive package. Believe me, it saves you a lot of money if you use it well. The Nikko is within walking distance of the Ferry Terminal and of great shopping on Nathan Road, The Jade and Night Markets. Restaurants abound in the area and if one wishes excellent non-asian cuisine, go to the Knutsford Terrace off Nathan Road. The Island Seafood House is out of this world as is the Italian restaurant there.

Reviews.Title: “Nikko Hotel in HK-a complete disappointment”
Reviews.Author: vincewong2
Reviews.Content: It just occur to me that I should share my experience with fellow online hotel shoppers even though my experience with this hotel was almost a year ago. Booked a room at Nikko Hotel in Hong Kong in Dec 2005 through Orbitz at a fantastic rate. Confirmed twice with Orbitz the reservation was firm before I left US. Upon arrival on the 23rd of Dec., Nikko Hotel claimed no such reservation was on file and flatly denied us a room even after I showed my paper confirmation. The manager there Mr. Park curtly said "We can't be responsible for online reservations made on other websites and what's more I have never heard of Orbitz". Given it was Christmas time, I thought he was very unsympathetic because he made no accommodation to the stressful situation. The desk receptionist confirmed there were rooms available but the manager would only let us have the room for about twice the price that we paid for at Orbitz. After 45-minutes with him, we gave up. He treated us as if we were trying to 'cheat' the hotel and we felt hurt. I would imagine a five-star Japanese hotel would be more understanding and willing to make adjustment and work with 'stranded' customers. Later I wrote to the hotel headquarters in Tokyo providing the details. The customer service department clearly did not read the letter; they provided a generic apology for the inconvenience and claimed the hotel was full at that time and there wasn't much that could be done. I would not recommend this hotel at all because of the attitude displayed by the manager. If this were a 1 or 2 star-small hotel, I can understand. But for a well known hotel that claims excellence for their service on their website, this was a complete let down. Incidentally, the location of this hotel isn't that great either as we found out.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.. very special!”
Reviews.Author: Kat_Orr
Reviews.Content: For the price of this hotel and the prime location, it is incredibly good value. My fiance and I got the Harbour view room and it was incredible. It had all the mod cons in it.. electric curtain rail!!! Decorated in a beautiful modern oriental style and incredibly spacious unlike a lot of hotels in Hong Kong. Bathroom was simply beautiful, had a walk in shower which was large and a bath. Little things like the toilettries they gave were brill too! Service was brilliant and the general feel of the hotel was relaxed which is what you need on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable rate, good location”
Reviews.Author: Reed&Shiho
Reviews.Content: Unlike Intercontinental Hong Kong or Four Seasons Hotel Hong Kong, this is not a five-star hotel. However, we love this hotel because of its reasonable room rate. You can find 1000HKD (roughly 120USD) standard room throughout the year. The hotel is old, but renovation has been finished. The room is clean. Many restaurants serving Chinese, Italian or Japanese, are located in walking distance. Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast buffet”
Reviews.Author: Twofootplus
Reviews.Content: This was an overnight stop on the way from London to Brisbane. On previous trips we had stayed in the New World Renaissance and the Langham Place; the Nikko seemed newer, the room more spacious and the price lower. The Nikko is in Tsim Sha Tsui East, only slightly further from the Star ferry than the New World Renaissance, a 5 minute walk to the Avenue of Stars, and near MTR and KTR stations. There is a bridge across the busy road to get to the harbour promenade. There are a few shops and malls close by (actually there are few places in HK that don’t have a mall close by!). We were able to check in early. The bed (crisp cotton sheets and duvet) was luxuriously comfortable. Everything was clean. Staff were friendly and efficient. Our 9th floor double room with harbour view had broadband for a small charge, minibar, kettle and complimentary tea and coffee (not quite as good as Langham Place’s filter coffee-maker). A star feature was the breakfast buffet, well worth the cost: cereals, fruit, patisserie; cooked items such as bacon, sausages, hash browns, pancakes and waffles; Chinese breakfast dishes, plus eggs cooked to order any way you want, including omelettes with smoked salmon, cheese, ham, etc. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Its on "OK" hotel and quite expensive for the room size”
Reviews.Author: Kawah2750
Reviews.Content: Hotel is fine, nothing special, staff are friendly enough though not very flexible. Food is "OK" but not to a very high standard. Have stayed there a couple of times but will look for an alternative next time I visit Hong Kong. Its handy for the Ferry to Shenzen which is a good point. Nothing to get exited over.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: NAEEMFAROOI
Reviews.Content: I have been to Hong kong at the end of july staying at NIKKO hotel Hong kong with my family. It was an excellent experience with a large family of 12 to stay in together, the staff was cool and extremely helpful & they were much caring of my small kids as there nuns. The rooms was large enough to fit myself with my 2 small kids. The good thing is that, that all underground train stations are very nearby. all in all I hereby suggest for families to really check this hotel before checking in another.
